nb30DeviceDisableBdg.name: nb30DeviceDisableBdg
nb30DeviceDisableBdg.description: Indicates if the bridge will be disabled.

nb30DeviceRestoreSettings.name: nb30DeviceRestoreSettings
nb30DeviceRestoreSettings.description: Restore the following settings to their default values: Bridge Name to CABLETRON REMOTE BRIDGE, Location to LOCAL, Enet Port 1 Name to ETHERNET PORT 1, Enet Port 2 Name to ETHERNET PORT 2, Remote Port Name to REMOTE PORT, Enet Port 1 Network Name to LAN_1, Enet Port 2 Network Name to LAN_2, Defualt Enet Port to Port 1, Enable Redundancy to NO, Port 1 and Port 2 Poll Address to 00-00-00-00-00-00, Port 1 and Port 2 Poll Interval to 5 Seconds, Port 1 and Port 2 Max Retries to 6, Remote Port Network Name to REMOTE LINK, Ageing Time for Acquired Database to 300 seconds, Place seventeen default multicast addresses into the permanent and acquired databases, Type of Spanning Tree to 802.1, Type of Filtering to IEEE 802.1, Bridge Max Age to 20 seconds, Bridge Forward Delay to 15 seconds, Bridge Hello Time to 2 seconds, Bridge Priority to 8000, Port 1 Priority to 80, Port 2 Priority to 80, Port 1 Path Cost to 1000, Port 2 Path Cost to 1000, Number of Restarts to 0.

nb30DeviceBdgName.name: nb30DeviceBdgName
nb30DeviceBdgName.description: The user-defined name (up to 32 characters long) of the bridge. The default bridge name is CABLETRON REMOTE BRIDGE.

nb30DeviceNumPorts.name: nb30DeviceNumPorts
nb30DeviceNumPorts.description: The number of ports present on the bridge.

nb30DeviceVersion.name: nb30DeviceVersion
nb30DeviceVersion.description: The release version of the firmware installed in the bridge.

nb30DeviceLocation.name: nb30DeviceLocation
nb30DeviceLocation.description: The user-defined name (up to 14 characters long) to indicate the location of the bridge on the network. The default location name is LOCAL.

nb30DeviceStatus.name: nb30DeviceStatus
nb30DeviceStatus.description: The status of the bridge, ON-LINE, STAND BY or DISABLED.

nb30DeviceRestartBdg.name: nb30DeviceRestartBdg
nb30DeviceRestartBdg.description: Force the bridge to undergo a software reset.

nb30DeviceFrFwds.name: nb30DeviceFrFwds
nb30DeviceFrFwds.description: The number of frames forwarded by the bridge.

nb30DeviceFrRxs.name: nb30DeviceFrRxs
nb30DeviceFrRxs.description: The number of frames received by the bridge.

nb30DeviceFrFlts.name: nb30DeviceFrFlts
nb30DeviceFrFlts.description: The number of frames filtered by the bridge.

nb30DeviceErrs.name: nb30DeviceErrs
nb30DeviceErrs.description: The total number of network errors that have occurred.

nb30DeviceNumRestarts.name: nb30DeviceNumRestarts
nb30DeviceNumRestarts.description: The number of times the bridge has been powered up or restarted.

nb30DeviceTypeFiltering.name: nb30DeviceTypeFiltering
nb30DeviceTypeFiltering.description: The type of filtering to be performed by the bridge. The default is IEEE 802.1.

nb30DeviceSTAProtocol.name: nb30DeviceSTAProtocol
nb30DeviceSTAProtocol.description: The spanning tree algorithm under which the bridge is operating. The selections are as follows: - IEEE 802.1 compliant spanning tree algorithm environment (802.1) - DEC LAN Bridge 100 environment (DEC) - Without the spanning tree algorithm enabled (NONE) The default is 802.1.

nb30DeviceBridgeID.name: nb30DeviceBridgeID
nb30DeviceBridgeID.description: The unique identifier of the bridge. The first two bytes of the identifier are the bridge priority and the last six bytes are the Ethernet address.

nb30DeviceTopChgCnts.name: nb30DeviceTopChgCnts
nb30DeviceTopChgCnts.description: The number of times the bridge's Topology Change Flag has been changed since the bridge was powered up or initialized.

nb30DeviceTimeTopChg.name: nb30DeviceTimeTopChg
nb30DeviceTimeTopChg.description: The time in seconds that has elapsed since the bridge's Topology Change Flag last recorded the value of a topology change.

nb30DeviceTopChg.name: nb30DeviceTopChg
nb30DeviceTopChg.description: Indicates if a bridge topology change is in progress.

nb30DeviceRootCost.name: nb30DeviceRootCost
nb30DeviceRootCost.description: The cost of the path to the root from this bridge.

nb30DeviceRootPort.name: nb30DeviceRootPort
nb30DeviceRootPort.description: The port identifier for the port which offers the lowest cost path to the root, i.e. that port for which the sum of the values of the designated cost and path cost parameters held for the port is lowest.

nb30DeviceDesigRoot.name: nb30DeviceDesigRoot
nb30DeviceDesigRoot.description: The unique identifier of the bridge recorded as the root.

nb30DeviceMaxAge.name: nb30DeviceMaxAge
nb30DeviceMaxAge.description: The maximum age of received protocol information before it is discarded.

nb30DeviceHoldTime.name: nb30DeviceHoldTime
nb30DeviceHoldTime.description: The minimum time period elapsing between the transmission of configuration BPDU's through a given bridge port.

nb30DeviceFwdDly.name: nb30DeviceFwdDly
nb30DeviceFwdDly.description: The time spent in the listening state while moving from the blocking state to the learning state, or the time spent in the learning state while moving from the listening state to the forwarding state.

nb30DeviceHelloTime.name: nb30DeviceHelloTime
nb30DeviceHelloTime.description: The time interval between the transmission of Configuration BPDU's by a bridge which is attempting to become the root or is the root.

nb30DeviceBdgFwdDly.name: nb30DeviceBdgFwdDly
nb30DeviceBdgFwdDly.description: The value of the forward delay parameter when the bridge is the root or is attempting to become the root. A time of 4 to 30 seconds is allowed. The default is 15 seconds.

nb30DeviceBdgMaxAge.name: nb30DeviceBdgMaxAge
nb30DeviceBdgMaxAge.description: The value of the Max Age parameter when the bridge is the root or is attempting to become the root. A time of 6 to 40 seconds is allowed. The default is 20 seconds.

nb30DeviceBdgHello.name: nb30DeviceBdgHello
nb30DeviceBdgHello.description: The value of the Hello Time parameter when the bridge is the root or is attempting to become the root. A time of 1 to 10 seconds is allowed. The default is 2 seconds.

nb30DeviceBdgPriority.name: nb30DeviceBdgPriority
nb30DeviceBdgPriority.description: Used in the spanning tree for priority comparisons. Allowed range is 0 through FFFF. The default is 8000.

nb30DeviceUptime.name: nb30DeviceUptime
nb30DeviceUptime.description: The time, in seconds, that has elapsed since the bridge was last reset or initialized.

nb30DeviceRootSwitch.name: nb30DeviceRootSwitch
nb30DeviceRootSwitch.description: The status of the Root switch on the front panel of the NB30.

nb30DeviceFwdBroadcast.name: nb30DeviceFwdBroadcast
nb30DeviceFwdBroadcast.description: The status of the Forward Broadcast switch on the front panel of the NB30.

nb30DeviceConfigSw1.name: nb30DeviceConfigSw1
nb30DeviceConfigSw1.description: The status of Config switch 1 on the back panel of the NB30.

nb30DeviceConfigSw2.name: nb30DeviceConfigSw2
nb30DeviceConfigSw2.description: The status of Config switch 2 on the back panel of the NB30.

nb30DeviceConfigSw3.name: nb30DeviceConfigSw3
nb30DeviceConfigSw3.description: The status of Config switch 3 on the back panel of the NB30.

nb30DeviceConfigSw4.name: nb30DeviceConfigSw4
nb30DeviceConfigSw4.description: The status of Config switch 4 on the back panel of the NB30.

nb30DevicePortActive.name: nb30DevicePortActive
nb30DevicePortActive.description: The Port number which is acting as the online Ethernet Port on the NB30.

nb30DeviceDefPort.name: nb30DeviceDefPort
nb30DeviceDefPort.description: The Port number which is Default Ethernet Port on the NB30 at power up.

nb30DeviceRedEnable.name: nb30DeviceRedEnable
nb30DeviceRedEnable.description: The state of the Redundancy Enable Flag.

nb30DsxLoopUp.name: nb30DsxLoopUp
nb30DsxLoopUp.description: The loop up command for the DSX-1 Remote Interface.

nb30DsxLoopDn.name: nb30DsxLoopDn
nb30DsxLoopDn.description: The loop down command for the DSX-1 Remote Interface.

nb30DsxLoopSt.name: nb30DsxLoopSt
nb30DsxLoopSt.description: The loop status for the DSX-1 Remote Interface.

nb30DsxLoopPattern.name: nb30DsxLoopPattern
nb30DsxLoopPattern.description: The loop test pattern for the DSX-1 Remote Interface.

nb30DsxChannelTable.name: nb30DsxChannelTable
nb30DsxChannelTable.description: NB30 DSX-1 Remote Port Channelization Table

nb30DsxChannelId.name: nb30DsxChannelId
nb30DsxChannelId.description: The channel number for this entry.

nb30PortAddress.name: nb30PortAddress
nb30PortAddress.description: The Ethernet address of the port. Instance of 1 represents the local Ethernet address, instance of 2 represents the remote Ethernet address.

nb30PortName.name: nb30PortName
nb30PortName.description: The user-defined name (up to 32 characters long) assigned to the port. The default Enet port 1 name is ETHERNET PORT 1 and the default Enet Port 2 name is ETHERNET PORT 2.

nb30PortType.name: nb30PortType
nb30PortType.description: The IEEE specification the port meets, e.g. 802.3.

nb30PortStatus.name: nb30PortStatus
nb30PortStatus.description: The status in which the port is operating. The status messages for Ports 1 and 2 are: OFF - The port is off, due to a failed network interface chip associated with that port. OK/SQE ON - The port is communicating with the network and the transceiver making the connection to the network has SQE enabled. OK/SQE OFF - The port is communicating with the network and the transceiver making the connection to the network has SQE disabled. CARRIER LOST - Communication with the network has not been established or has been lost.

nb30PortNetName.name: nb30PortNetName
nb30PortNetName.description: The user-defined name (up to 32 characters long) assigned to a network segment connected to the port. The default network name for Port 1 is LAN_1 and the default network name for Port 2 is LAN_2.

nb30PortFrRxs.name: nb30PortFrRxs
nb30PortFrRxs.description: The number of frames received at the specified port.

nb30PortDisInbounds.name: nb30PortDisInbounds
nb30PortDisInbounds.description: The total number of valid frames that were received at the port but then discarded by the bridge in the forwarding process.

nb30PortFwdOutbs.name: nb30PortFwdOutbs
nb30PortFwdOutbs.description: The number of frames forwarded successfully to the appropriate port.

nb30PortDisLOBs.name: nb30PortDisLOBs
nb30PortDisLOBs.description: The number of packets that were discarded by the bridge because of a lack of buffer space to maintain the data.

nb30PortDisTDEs.name: nb30PortDisTDEs
nb30PortDisTDEs.description: The number of frames that were intended for forwarding but were discarded when the maximum time period set for transmission was exceeded before forwarding was possible.

nb30PortCollisions.name: nb30PortCollisions
nb30PortCollisions.description: The number of collisions that have occurred on the network at the specified port.

nb30PortTxAborts.name: nb30PortTxAborts
nb30PortTxAborts.description: The number of transmissions that have been aborted due to excessive collisions (over 16 attempts to transmit the same packet).

nb30PortOowCollisions.name: nb30PortOowCollisions
nb30PortOowCollisions.description: The number of collisions out of the standard collision window (51.2 uS). This indicates a network problem.

nb30PortCRCErrs.name: nb30PortCRCErrs
nb30PortCRCErrs.description: The number of packets detected with Cyclical Redundancy Check failures.

nb30PortFrAlignErrs.name: nb30PortFrAlignErrs
nb30PortFrAlignErrs.description: The number of errors due to misaligned packets.

nb30PortPriority.name: nb30PortPriority
nb30PortPriority.description: The part of the port identifier which is used with the spanning tree algorithm when determining which port in a LAN segment has priority. The default is 80. Applies to the LOCAL and REMOTE Ethernet ports where instance 1 always refers to the local ethernet port and instance 2 always refers to the remote ethernet port.

nb30PortState.name: nb30PortState
nb30PortState.description: The current state of the port, DISABLED, LISTENING, LEARNING, FORWARDING or BLOCKING. Applies to the LOCAL and REMOTE Ethernet ports where instance 1 always refers to the local ethernet port and instance 2 always refers to the remote ethernet port.

nb30PortPathCost.name: nb30PortPathCost
nb30PortPathCost.description: The contributory cost of the applicable port to the overall cost of the path when the specified port is the root port. Allowable range is 1 to 65535. The default is 1000. Applies to the LOCAL and REMOTE Ethernet ports where instance 1 always refers to the local ethernet port and instance 2 always refers to the remote ethernet port.

nb30PortDesigCost.name: nb30PortDesigCost
nb30PortDesigCost.description: The cost of the path of this port to the root bridge on the network. Applies to the LOCAL and REMOTE Ethernet ports where instance 1 always refers to the local ethernet port and instance 2 always refers to the remote ethernet port.

nb30PortDesigBrdg.name: nb30PortDesigBrdg
nb30PortDesigBrdg.description: The network address of the bridge that is assumed to be the root bridge on the network. Applies to the LOCAL and REMOTE Ethernet ports where instance 1 always refers to the local ethernet port and instance 2 always refers to the remote ethernet port.

nb30PortDesigPort.name: nb30PortDesigPort
nb30PortDesigPort.description: The port identifier of the bridge port believed to be the designated port for the LAN associated with the port. Applies to the LOCAL and REMOTE Ethernet ports where instance 1 always refers to the local ethernet port and instance 2 always refers to the remote ethernet port.

nb30PortTopChgAck.name: nb30PortTopChgAck
nb30PortTopChgAck.description: The value of the topology change acknowledgement flag in the next configuration BPDU to be transmitted on the associated port. Applies to the LOCAL and REMOTE Ethernet ports where instance 1 always refers to the local ethernet port and instance 2 always refers to the remote ethernet port.

nb30PortDesigRoot.name: nb30PortDesigRoot
nb30PortDesigRoot.description: The unique bridge identifier of the bridge that is assumed to be the root bridge on the network. Applies to the LOCAL and REMOTE Ethernet ports where instance 1 always refers to the local ethernet port and instance 2 always refers to the remote ethernet port.

nb30PortOversizePkts.name: nb30PortOversizePkts
nb30PortOversizePkts.description: The number of packets received at the indicated NB30 Port that were greater than the IEEE 802.3 maximum Ethernet frame size of 1518 bytes.

nb30PortFrFiltereds.name: nb30PortFrFiltereds
nb30PortFrFiltereds.description: The number of frames received at the indicated port that were filtered by the bridge.

nb30PortPollAddress.name: nb30PortPollAddress
nb30PortPollAddress.description: The Poll Address that will be used by the Redundant Port Algorithm on the NB30.

nb30PortPollInterval.name: nb30PortPollInterval
nb30PortPollInterval.description: The Poll Interval used by the Redundant Port Algorithm on the NB30. Valid range is 1 - 30 seconds.

nb30PortMaxRetry.name: nb30PortMaxRetry
nb30PortMaxRetry.description: The Max number of retries for the Redundant Port Algorithm on the NB30. Valid range is 2 - 99 retries

nb30PortId.name: nb30PortId
nb30PortId.description: The port number for this entry.

nb30RemPortName.name: nb30RemPortName
nb30RemPortName.description: The user-defined name assigned to the remote port. The default Remote port name is REMOTE PORT.

nb30RemPortType.name: nb30RemPortType
nb30RemPortType.description: The Electrical interface specification the port meets, e.g. DSX-1, V.35.

nb30RemPortStatus.name: nb30RemPortStatus
nb30RemPortStatus.description: The status in which the remote port is operating. The status messages for the Remote Port are: NO EXT CLOCK DCE NOT READY / NO DM DCE NOT READY / NO CTS LINK OK / DCE READY NET LOOP / RED ALARM REM LOOP / RED ALARM NORMAL / RED ALARM NET LOOP / YELLOW ALARM REM LOOP / YELLOW ALARM NORMAL / YELLOW ALARM NET LOOP / LINK OK REM LOOP / LINK OK NORMAL / LINK OK NET LOOP / LINK LOST REM LOOP / LINK LOST NORMAL / LINK LOST

nb30RemPortNetName.name: nb30RemPortNetName
nb30RemPortNetName.description: The user-defined name assigned to a wide area segment connected to the remote port. The default network name for Remote Port is REMOTE LINK.

nb30RemPortFrRxs.name: nb30RemPortFrRxs
nb30RemPortFrRxs.description: The number of frames received at the remote port.

nb30RemPortFwdOutbs.name: nb30RemPortFwdOutbs
nb30RemPortFwdOutbs.description: The number of frames forwarded successfully to the remote port.

nb30RemPortDisLOBs.name: nb30RemPortDisLOBs
nb30RemPortDisLOBs.description: The number of packets that were discarded by the bridge because of a lack of buffer space to maintain the data.

nb30RemPortDisTDEs.name: nb30RemPortDisTDEs
nb30RemPortDisTDEs.description: The number of frames that were intended for forwarding but were discarded when the maximum time period set for transmission was exceeded before forwarding was possible.

nb30RemPortCRCErrs.name: nb30RemPortCRCErrs
nb30RemPortCRCErrs.description: The number of packets detected with Cyclical Redundancy Check failures.

nb30RemPortFrAlErrs.name: nb30RemPortFrAlErrs
nb30RemPortFrAlErrs.description: The number of errors due to misaligned packets.

nb30RemPortId.name: nb30RemPortId
nb30RemPortId.description: The remote port ID, there is only a single port which is identified as 0.

nb30AcqTotalEntries.name: nb30AcqTotalEntries
nb30AcqTotalEntries.description: The total number of entries in the acquired database.

nb30AcqMaxEntries.name: nb30AcqMaxEntries
nb30AcqMaxEntries.description: The maximum number of entries allowed in the acquired database 8191 entries.

nb30AcqStaticEntries.name: nb30AcqStaticEntries
nb30AcqStaticEntries.description: The number of addresses added to the Acquired database by the user or network manager.

nb30AcqDynamicEntries.name: nb30AcqDynamicEntries
nb30AcqDynamicEntries.description: The number of entries that have been accumulated in the Acquired database through the bridge's learning process.

nb30AcqDynAgeTime.name: nb30AcqDynAgeTime
nb30AcqDynAgeTime.description: The length of time allowed for a dynamic entry in the acquired database to be inactive before it is dropped from the database. A time from 10 - 1,000,000 seconds is allowed. The default is 300 seconds.

nb30AcqEraseDatabase.name: nb30AcqEraseDatabase
nb30AcqEraseDatabase.description: Set to one to erase all entries in the acquired database.

nb30AcqCreateFilter.name: nb30AcqCreateFilter
nb30AcqCreateFilter.description: Add an entry to the acquired database to filter packets entering port 1 if those packets are destined for the specified address.

nb30AcqCreateForward.name: nb30AcqCreateForward
nb30AcqCreateForward.description: Add an entry to the acquired database to forward packets entering port 1 to the remote port if those packets are destined for the specified address.

nb30AcqDeleteFilter.name: nb30AcqDeleteFilter
nb30AcqDeleteFilter.description: Delete an entry from the acquired database.

nb30AcqFilterType.name: nb30AcqFilterType
nb30AcqFilterType.description: Display the entry type, STATIC or DYNAMIC.

nb30AcqFilterAction.name: nb30AcqFilterAction
nb30AcqFilterAction.description: The action to be taken for packets entering port 1.

nb30AcqSourceAddress.name: nb30AcqSourceAddress
nb30AcqSourceAddress.description: The source address of this acquired database entry, i.e. the instance.

nb30AcqMacAddress.name: nb30AcqMacAddress
nb30AcqMacAddress.description: The MAC address for the specific entry.

nb30PermMaxEntries.name: nb30PermMaxEntries
nb30PermMaxEntries.description: The maximum number of entries allowed in the permanent database 2047 entries.

nb30PermCurrentEntries.name: nb30PermCurrentEntries
nb30PermCurrentEntries.description: The number of entries currently recorded in the bridge's permanent database.

nb30PermEraseDatabase.name: nb30PermEraseDatabase
nb30PermEraseDatabase.description: Erase all entries in the permanent database.

nb30PermCreateFilter.name: nb30PermCreateFilter
nb30PermCreateFilter.description: Add an entry to the permanent database to filter packets entering port 1 if those packets are destined for the specified address.

nb30PermCreateForward.name: nb30PermCreateForward
nb30PermCreateForward.description: Add an entry to the permanent database to forward packets entering port 1 to the remote port if those packets are destined for the specified address.

nb30PermDeleteEntry.name: nb30PermDeleteEntry
nb30PermDeleteEntry.description: Delete an entry from the permanent database.

nb30PermFilterAction.name: nb30PermFilterAction
nb30PermFilterAction.description: The action taken on packets entering port 1.

nb30PermSourceAddress.name: nb30PermSourceAddress
nb30PermSourceAddress.description: The source address in this permanent database entry, i.e. the instance.

nb30PermDBMacAddress.name: nb30PermDBMacAddress
nb30PermDBMacAddress.description: The specific MAC address for this entry.

nb30SpecNumEntries.name: nb30SpecNumEntries
nb30SpecNumEntries.description: The number of filters in the special database.

nb30SpecMaxEntries.name: nb30SpecMaxEntries
nb30SpecMaxEntries.description: The maximum number of filters the special database can contain.

nb30SpecNextFilterNum.name: nb30SpecNextFilterNum
nb30SpecNextFilterNum.description: The number of the next available filter that can be added to the special database. This OID will return a 255 if the database is full

nb30SpecPort1.name: nb30SpecPort1
nb30SpecPort1.description: Set port 1 to filter or forward packets.

nb30SpecDestAddress.name: nb30SpecDestAddress
nb30SpecDestAddress.description: Set the special database to filter packets with a specific destination address.

nb30SpecSrcAddress.name: nb30SpecSrcAddress
nb30SpecSrcAddress.description: Set the special database to filter packets with a specific source address.

nb30SpecType.name: nb30SpecType
nb30SpecType.description: Set the special database to filter packets with a specific type field.

nb30SpecDataField.name: nb30SpecDataField
nb30SpecDataField.description: Set the special database to filter packets based on the first sixteen bytes of data in the packet.

nb30SpecDeleteFilter.name: nb30SpecDeleteFilter
nb30SpecDeleteFilter.description: Delete a filter from the special database.

nb30SpecDbFilterNumber.name: nb30SpecDbFilterNumber
nb30SpecDbFilterNumber.description: The specific special data base filter number.
